item.title: 美国起诉高塔姆-阿达尼涉嫌贿赂案的主要事件
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌参与印度一项价值 2.65 亿美元的贿赂计划而被美国检察官起诉，这使他的企业集团在两年内第二次深陷危机。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani has been indicted by U.S. prosecutors for his alleged role in a $265 million bribery scheme in India, plunging his conglomerate deep into crisis for the second time in two years.】

item.title: 英伟达预测令人失望，纳斯达克期货领跌
item.description: 纳斯达克期货周四领跌美国股指期货，英伟达（Nvidia）股价在盘前交易中下跌，此前投资者对这家人工智能领军企业的营收预期不以为然。【原文：Nasdaq futures led declines among U.S. stock index futures on Thursday, with Nvidia's shares falling in premarket trading after investors were unimpressed by the AI leader's revenue forecast.】

item.title: 在对特朗普关税的担忧中，中国宣布促进贸易的政策措施
item.description: 中国商务部周四宣布了一系列旨在促进中国对外贸易的政策措施，包括承诺加强对企业的融资支持和扩大农产品出口。【原文：China's commerce ministry on Thursday announced a series of policy measures aimed at boosting the country's foreign trade, including pledging to strengthen financing support to firms and expand exports of agricultural products.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：美联储主席巴尔金称美国易受通胀冲击影响
item.description: 里士满联邦储备银行行长汤姆-巴金（Tom Barkin）周三在接受《金融时报》采访时表示，美国比过去更容易受到通胀冲击的影响。【原文：The U.S. is more vulnerable to inflationary shocks than in the past, Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Tom Barkin said in an interview with the Financial Times published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴将电子商务平台整合为单一业务部门
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团周四在提交给证券交易所的文件中表示，将把旗下所有电子商务平台整合为一个单一的业务部门，命名为阿里巴巴电子商务事业群。【原文：Alibaba Group will integrate all of its e-commerce platforms into a single business unit to be called the Alibaba E-commerce Business Group, it said in a stock exchange filing on Thursday.】

item.title: 日产称约 1,000 名美国员工接受提前退休
item.description: 日产汽车公司发言人周四表示，该公司约有 6% 的美国员工接受了提前退休方案，这是这家陷入困境的日本汽车制造商在全球裁员 9000 人计划的一部分。【原文：About 6% of Nissan Motor staff in the United States have accepted early retirement packages, a company spokesperson said on Thursday, as part of the struggling Japanese carmaker's plan to cut 9,000 jobs worldwide.】

item.title: 美国监管机构发布监管大科技支付和数字钱包的最终规则
item.description: 美国消费者金融保护局（Consumer Financial Protection Bureau）表示，每年通过数字钱包和支付应用程序处理超过 130 亿笔金融交易的硅谷科技巨头和其他公司将接受政府监管。【原文：Silicon Valley tech giants and others who together process more than 13 billion financial transactions annually through digital wallets and payment apps will be subject to government supervision, the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said.】

item.title: 在美国对高塔姆-阿达尼的起诉书中被指控的被告是谁？
item.description: 美国检察官指控印度亿万富翁、以其名字命名的企业集团创始人高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）和其他七人涉嫌与印度一个可再生能源项目有关的贿赂和欺诈计划。【原文：U.S. prosecutors have charged Indian billionaire Gautam Adani, founder of a conglomerate named after him, and seven others in an alleged bribery and fraud scheme related to a renewable energy project in India.】

item.title: 印度反对党呼吁调查阿达尼，莫迪领导的印度人民党质疑美国起诉的时机
item.description: 印度反对党周四要求对阿达尼集团的不法行为指控进行调查，并表示将在该集团主席高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌贿赂计划在美国受到指控后在议会提出这一问题。【原文：Indian opposition parties demanded a probe on Thursday into allegations of wrongdoing by the Adani Group and said they would raise the issue in parliament after its chair Gautam Adani was charged in the U.S. over an alleged bribery scheme.】

item.title: 德国商业银行任命新首席财务官，裕信银行与之接洽
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank）周四任命卡斯滕-施密特（Carsten Schmitt）为新任首席财务官，这是这家德国第二大银行的关键职位，因为该银行正努力抵御意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）提出的并购要求。【原文：Commerzbank on Thursday named Carsten Schmitt as its new chief financial officer, a crucial role at Germany's No. 2 lender as it seeks to fend off an approach by Italy's UniCredit for a tie-up.】

item.title: 中国百度第三季度营收下降 3%，符合市场预期
item.description: 中国最大的互联网搜索服务提供商百度周四公布的第三季度财报显示，百度第三季度营收下降 3%，符合市场预期。【原文：Baidu reported a 3% fall in third-quarter revenue on Thursday, meeting market estimates, as China's biggest internet search provider grappled with weak spending on its advertising services in a sluggish economy.】

item.title: 美国检察官要求谷歌剥离 Chrome 浏览器以结束搜索垄断
item.description: 美国检察官周三向法官提出，谷歌必须出售其 Chrome 浏览器，与竞争对手共享数据和搜索结果，并采取一系列其他措施结束其在网络搜索领域的垄断地位。【原文：U.S. prosecutors on Wednesday argued to a judge that Google must sell its Chrome browser, share data, and search results with rivals, and take a range of other measures to end its monopoly on online search.】

item.title: 为应对特朗普关税，中国国家主席习近平在全球峰会上推动外交努力
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）再次当选美国总统后的首次全球会晤中，中国国家主席习近平展开了外交攻势，对冲预期的新关税，并准备利用华盛顿与其盟友之间未来可能出现的裂痕。【原文：In his first global meetings since Donald Trump was reelected to lead the U.S., Chinese President Xi Jinping went on a diplomatic offensive, hedging against expected new tariffs and preparing to exploit potential future rifts between Washington and its allies.】

item.title: 在美国被起诉的高塔姆-阿达尼是备受争议的印度第一代富豪
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因 2.65 亿美元的贿赂计划在纽约被起诉，他是第一代富豪，在其惊人崛起的同时，也在国内外引发了一系列破坏性争议。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani, indicted in New York over a $265 million bribery scheme, is a first-generation tycoon whose phenomenal rise has been accompanied by a series of damaging controversies at home and abroad.】

item.title: 巴伦周刊》报道：美联储威廉姆斯认为通胀降温，利率进一步下降
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周四接受《巴伦周刊》（Barron's）采访时表示，他认为通胀会降温，利率会进一步下降。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams sees inflation cooling and interest rates falling further, he told Barron's in an interview published on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，尽管受到美国的限制，华为仍计划在 2025 年初量产最新人工智能芯片
item.description: 两位熟知内情的人士表示，中国华为计划在 2025 年第一季度开始量产其最先进的人工智能芯片，尽管由于美国的限制，华为还在努力生产足够的芯片。【原文：China's Huawei plans to start mass-producing its most advanced artificial intelligence chip in the first quarter of 2025, even as it struggles to make enough chips due to U.S. restrictions, said two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: HEDGEFLOW 高盛：美国对冲基金扎堆中国剑网和 GDS
item.description: 路透社查阅的一份高盛（Goldman Sachs）报告显示，美国对冲基金在第三季度增加了对在美国上市的中国企业的投资，其中电子商务零售商京东商城（JD.com）和数据中心运营商GDS控股公司（GDS Holdings）的投资额居前。【原文：U.S. hedge funds raised their investments in U.S.-listed Chinese firms in the third quarter, with e-commerce retailer JD.com and data centre operator GDS Holdings leading the purchases, a Goldman Sachs note reviewed by Reuters showed.】

item.title: 大众汽车进入第三轮工资谈判，罢工行动迫在眉睫
item.description: 大众汽车管理层和工人代表将于本周四开始第三轮工资谈判，在工会威胁要通过在德国各工厂举行罢工将斗争升级之前，双方只剩下十天时间来寻找解决方案。【原文：Volkswagen management and worker representatives begin a third round of wage negotiations on Thursday, with just ten days left to find a solution before unions have threatened to escalate the fight with strikes across German sites.】

item.title: 美国国家橄榄球联盟（NFL）的巨大收视率经受住了选举季的考验
item.description: 在刚刚过去的选举季中，NFL 的电视收视率依然强劲。【原文：The NFL's television ratings remained strong in the wake of the recent election season.】

item.title: 小麦种植者收紧库存，面粉加工厂面临供应紧张问题
item.description: 一些出口国的小麦种植者不愿意出售他们的作物，贸易商、农民和磨坊主说，由于价格接近四年来的最低点，面粉生产商的供应越来越少，很容易受到任何潜在价格上涨的影响。【原文：Wheat growers in several exporting countries are reluctant to sell their crops with prices near four-year lows, traders, farmers and millers say, leaving flour makers with dwindling supplies and vulnerable to any potential upswing in prices.】

item.title: 早间竞价英伟达令人失望，比特币接近 10 万美元
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 集装箱托运人通过订购双燃料船实现绿色转型
item.description: 马士基（Maersk）、达飞轮船（CMA CGM）和中远（COSCO）等集装箱航运公司近年来订购了数百艘新船，旨在帮助其行业减少温室气体（GHG）排放，以满足全球客户和监管机构日益增长的需求。【原文：Container shipping companies like Maersk , CMA CGM and COSCO have ordered hundreds of new vessels in recent years meant to help their industry slash greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions to meet rising demand from customers and regulators around the globe.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，星巴克考虑出售中国业务股份
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，星巴克正在探索中国业务的各种选择，包括出售股权的可能性。【原文：Starbucks is exploring options for its Chinese operations, including the possibility of selling a stake in the business, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 因美国对印度阿达尼公司的贿赂和欺诈指控，GQG Partners 股价暴跌逾 20
item.description: GQG Partners 持有印度阿达尼集团近 20% 的股份，该集团主席高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌贿赂和欺诈在美国被起诉后，其在澳大利亚上市的股票周四大跌 23%。【原文：GQG Partners , which has a near 20% stake in India's Adani Group, saw its Australia-listed shares plunge 23% on Thursday after Gautam Adani, the conglomerate's chair, was indicted in the U.S. over charges of bribery and fraud.】

item.title: 独家报道中国顾问呼吁稳定 2025 年 5%的经济增长目标并加大刺激力度
item.description: 中国政府顾问建议中国政府将明年的经济增长目标维持在 5.0% 左右，同时加大财政刺激力度，以减轻美国提高关税的预期对中国出口的影响。【原文：Chinese government advisers are recommending that Beijing should maintain an economic growth target of around 5.0% for next year, pushing for stronger fiscal stimulus to mitigate the impact of expected U.S. tariff hikes on the country's exports.】

item.title: 特朗普任命卢特尼克领导美国贸易和关税事务后，他与中国的关系引来抨击
item.description: 本周三，共和党当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）任命投资银行家霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）领导那些已成为中美贸易战矛头所指的机构。【原文：Investment banker Howard Lutnick's exposure to China came into sharp relief on Wednesday, after Republican President-elect Donald Trump tapped him to lead the agencies that have become the tip of the spear in the U.S.-China trade war.】

item.title: 司法部称谷歌必须剥离 Chrome 浏览器以结束搜索垄断
item.description: 美国检察官周三称，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌必须剥离其 Chrome 浏览器，并且在五年内不得重新进入浏览器市场，这是为结束谷歌搜索垄断而向法官提出的要求清单的一部分。【原文：Alphabet's Google must divest its Chrome browser and should not be allowed to re-enter the browser market for five years as part of a list of requests made to a judge to end Google's search monopoly, U.S. prosecutors argued on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国起诉后，印度阿达尼集团 220 亿美元价值化为乌有
item.description: 阿达尼集团公司的股票在周四早盘交易中市值损失约 220 亿美元，此前美国检察官指控这家印度企业集团的亿万富翁董事长涉嫌贿赂和欺诈。【原文：Shares of Adani Group companies lost about $22 billion in market value in early trade on Thursday after U.S. prosecutors charged the billionaire chairman of the Indian conglomerate in an alleged bribery and fraud scheme.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的 Neuralink 公司获加拿大批准进行脑芯片试验
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的神经链接公司（Neuralink）周三表示，它已获准在加拿大开展首次临床试验，该设备旨在让瘫痪者只需通过思考就能使用数字设备。【原文：Elon Musk's Neuralink said on Wednesday it has received approval to launch its first clinical trial in Canada for a device designed to give paralysed individuals the ability to use digital devices simply by thinking.】

item.title: 英伟达的预测打压风险偏好，亚洲股市有所回落
item.description: 亚洲股市周四下跌，此前人工智能宠儿英伟达（Nvidia）的收入预期令人失望，美元走强，比特币因预期美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）提出的政策而创下历史新高。【原文：Asian equities fell on Thursday after AI darling Nvidia disappointed investors with a subdued revenue forecast, while the dollar firmed and bitcoin hit a record high in anticipation of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's proposed policies.】
